isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built Before June 3, 2002 - install - DISC BRAKE PADS

svcprocinfo.para: There are three types of lining materials available for the hydraulic pin slide brake system. HX-7A1-EE brake pads and softer lining brake pads identified by lining code 7610 with smooth backing plates for heavy duty braking applications and HX-402-EE brake pads for light duty braking applications.

item.para:
The HX-7A1-EE lining material of inboard disc brake pad (Item 1, Figure 3)
and outboard disc brake pad (Item 2, Figure 3)
are chamfered and are marked with an "ARROW" and the word "FORWARD" for proper installation. Brake pads are NOT interchangeable from inboard to outboard side on the same wheel.

The optional HX-402-EE lining material of inboard and outboard disc brake pads (Item 3, Figure 3)
are NOT chamfered and ARE interchangeable from inboard to outboard side on the same wheel.

The optional SOFTER lining material of inboard and outboard disc brake pads (Item 3, Figure 3)
are NOT chamfered and ARE interchangeable from inboard to outboard side on the same wheel.

svcprocinfo.para:
If inspection reveals that caliper piston boots are worn or damaged, replace them. Refer to CALIPER, Remove
, CALIPER, Disassemble
, CALIPER, Clean and Inspect
, CALIPER, Assemble
and CALIPER, Install
to remove, disassemble, clean and inspect, assemble and install caliper and replace caliper piston boots.

During service procedure, keep grease and other foreign material from caliper assembly, disc brake pads, brake rotor and external surfaces of hub. Handle parts carefully to avoid damage to caliper, rotor, disc brake pads and brake lines.
The following steps refer to only one wheel. The same procedure will need to be performed at each wheel.

svcsubproc.title: Install

note.para:
Several changes have been incorporated within the anchor plate assembly and caliper mounting bolts on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002. It is important to recognize that these changes are not found on disc brakes on vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002, unless a complete rebuild of the anchor plate assembly was performed on the vehicle. The components that have changed are the leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 67)
and (Figure 68)
and caliper mounting bolts (Figure 71) .

caution.para:
When servicing vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002, it is recommended that the old guide pins (Figure 67)
be replaced with the new leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 68)
that are used on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002. Because of the differences in guide pins effective with brakes used on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002, any replacement of the guide pins should be done in pairs and the correct mounting bolts (Figure 71)
and torque must be used. Refer to CALIPER, Install
for proper torque requirements.

note.para:
If the old leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 67)
are being replaced with new leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 68)
as recommended, it is NOT necessary to remove the anchor plate and splash shield from the vehicle to replace the guide pins.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 27
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lower (bottom) hex mounting bolt (Item 2) securing the caliper (Item 1) to the anchor plate (Item 4) and remove caliper from anchor plate, position caliper out of the way on the vehicle suspension. Secure caliper assembly with a tywrap so that it does not fall. Be sure brake hose does not kink and does not support the weight of the caliper, driver side front brake shown.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 66
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
If old guide pins (Figure 67)
are being replaced with the new guide pins (Figure 68) . Pull guide pin boots (Item 4) off anchor plate (Item 1) or old guide pins and check for damage or defects. If damage or defects are found, they must be replaced. If guide pin boots are not damaged or defective, wash them in soapy water and dry them. Once again, after the guide pin boots have been cleaned and dried, inspect them for damage or defects. If damage or defects are found, they must be replaced. Refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Disassemble
, ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Clean and Inspect
and ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Assemble
to remove and install guide pins and guide pin boots.

important.para: Check new hex flanged mounting bolts for adhesive patch (Figure 71) , if no adhesive patch is found, apply a small patch of liquid loctite 2440 to the area indicated as adhesive patch in (Figure 71) . For best loctite 2440 performance, surfaces should be clean and free of grease. Loctite should be applied to the bolt in sufficient quantity to fill all engaged threads. Loctite develops usable strength within 1 hour and full strength at room temperature in 3 hours.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 72
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the new leading and trailing guide pins have been installed. Position caliper (Item 1) in place at lower mounting and align flat on guide pin head (Item 2) with the flat on caliper guide pin boss (Item 3), then install the new lower (bottom) hex flanged mounting bolt (Item 4) securing the caliper to the anchor plate (Item 5). Tighten to finger tight, driver side front brake shown.

note.para: When replacing disc brake pads, be sure to use the same brake lining material type on both axles. Mixing lining types can result in unbalanced braking and pad wear.
New disc brake pads come in axle sets, and new anchor plate pad abutment slippers are supplied with disc brake pad axle sets.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install new anchor plate pad abutment slippers (Item 3) onto anchor plate pad abutment, driver side front and rear brake shown.
Position inboard and outboard disc brake pads (Items 1 and 2) onto anchor plate pad abutment slippers (Item 3) with the lining facing toward the rotor, driver side front and rear brake shown.

caution.para: The HX-7A1-EE inboard and outboard disc brake pads (Items 1 and 2, Figure 59) are not interchangeable. The word "FORWARD" and the "ARROW" markings on the brake pad backing plate show forward rotation direction of the rotor (Item 3, Figure 59). The arrow MUST point in the forward rotor rotation direction (Figure 60). The optional HX-402-EE and SOFTER lining brake pads inboard and outboard disc brake pads (Item 4, Figure 59) are interchangeable between the inner and outer locations.

figure.caption: Figure 59. HX-7A1-EE Disc Brake Pads with FORWARD and ARROW Markings Show Forward Rotation Direction of Rotor

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HX-7A1-EE INBOARD DISC BRAKE PAD (CHAMFERED LINING)
2. HX-7A1-EE OUTBOARD DISC BRAKE PAD (CHAMFERED LINING)
4. HX-402-EE INBOARD OR OUTBOARD DISC BRAKE PAD (NOT CHAMFERED) OR SOFTER DISC BRAKE PAD WITH LINING CODE 7610 AND SMOOTH BACKING PLATE (NOT CHAMFERED)

figure.caption: Figure 60. Install HX-7A1-EE Inboard and Outboard Disc Brake Pads with Arrow in Forward Rotor Rotation Direction

step1.para: Make sure both caliper pistons are fully bottomed into caliper piston bores to provide clearance for new disc brake pads before caliper is rotated back into position.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 61 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Carefully rotate the caliper (Item 1) closed about the lower (bottom) hex flanged mounting bolt and guide pin (Items 2 and 3). Do not allow the brake line hose (Item 4) to become pinched or kinked, driver side front brake shown.

figure.caption: Figure 61. Rotate Caliper Closed About Lower Hex Mounting Bolt and Guide Pin
Figure 62. Rotate Caliper Closed and Install Upper Hex Mounting Bolt

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. CALIPER UPPER GUIDE PIN BOSS FLAT

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 62 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Align flat on upper (top) guide pin head (Item 1) with the flat on caliper upper (top) guide pin boss (Item 2). Use care when positioning caliper (Item 3) over the disc brake pads, rotor and upper (top) guide pin head (Items 4, 5 and 6) to avoid tearing, cutting or dislodging piston boots or guide pin boot (Items 7 and 8), driver side front brake shown.
Hold caliper (Item 3) in closed position with caliper upper guide pin boss hole aligned with threads in upper (top) guide pin head (Item 6), driver side front brake shown.

important.para: Check new hex flanged mounting bolts for adhesive patch (Figure 71) , if no adhesive patch is found, apply a small patch of liquid loctite 2440 to the area indicated as adhesive patch in (Figure 71) . For best loctite 2440 performance, surfaces should be clean and free of grease. Loctite should be applied to the bolt in sufficient quantity to fill all engaged threads. Loctite develops usable strength within 1 hour and full strength at room temperature in 3 hours.

step1.para: Install new upper (top) hex flanged mounting bolt (Item 9) finger tight, securing the caliper (Item 3) to the anchor plate (Item 10), driver side front brake shown.

caution.para:
After caliper has been secured by upper mounting bolt (Item 1, Figure 63)
on front caliper or (Item 4, Figure 63)
on rear caliper, loosen lower mounting bolt (Item 2, Figure 63)
on front caliper or (Item 3, Figure 63)
on rear caliper, it is important to tighten the mounting bolts in the proper sequence. Increased brake drag may result from not tightening in proper sequence. Use the tighten sequence and torque requirements in step 11 or step 12 below:

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 63
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If servicing disc brakes on vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002 that have NOT had the leading and trailing guide pins replaced, tighten the caliper mounting bolts as follows:

step2.para: For FRONT brakes, upper (top) mounting bolt (Item 1) should be tightened first, tighten to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 N•m). Then tighten lower (bottom) mounting bolt (Item 2), tighten to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 N•m).

For REAR brakes, lower (bottom) mounting bolt (Item 3) should be tightened first, tighten to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 N•m). Then tighten upper (top) mounting bolt (Item 4), tighten to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 N•m).

step1.para: If servicing disc brakes on vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002 that have had the leading and trailing guide pins replaced, tighten the caliper mounting bolts as follows:

step2.para: For FRONT brakes, upper (top) mounting bolt (Item 1) should be tightened first, tighten to 93 to 107 ft-lbs. (126 to 145 N•m). Then tighten lower (bottom) mounting bolt (Item 2), tighten to 93 to 107 ft-lbs. (126 to 145 N•m).

For REAR brakes, lower (bottom) mounting bolt (Item 3) should be tightened first, tighten to 93 to 107 ft-lbs. (126 to 145 N•m). Then tighten upper (top) mounting bolt (Item 4), tighten to 93 to 107 ft-lbs. (126 to 145 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Proper Sequence for Tightening Caliper Hex Mounting Bolts

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 64 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On front axles only, position brake line retaining clip (Item 2) over threaded stud (Item 3) on the steering knuckle hose support bracket (Item 4); make sure the brake line hose is not pinched or kinked. Install hex nut and lock washer (Item 1). Tighten to 115 to 140 in-lbs. (13 to 16 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Install Brake Line Retaining Clip and Install Hex Nut and Flat Washer

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 65 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On rear axles only, if vehicle is equipped with ABS brake system and/or air suspension system, place brake line retaining clip (Item 1) in position on caliper (Item 2) and install hex head bolt (Item 3). Tighten to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m). Place brake line retaining clip (Item 4) in position on axle (Item 5) and install hex head bolt (Item 6). Tighten to 20 ft-lbs. (27 N•m).

important.para: If any of the tywrap straps (Item 7) were cut off to allow caliper to rotate down during disc brake pad replacement, install new tywrap straps in the proper places after caliper and brake line hose have been secured.

figure.caption: Figure 65. Install Brake Line Retaining Clips on Rear Axle and Caliper

step1.para:
Install wheel (tire and rim) on vehicle and remove floor stands. Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS in the Master Service Manual for proper wheel installation. Refer to TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening specifications based on mounting hardware size and thread type.

note.para: When installing the wheel on disc brake axles, make sure the tire valve stem clears the brake caliper. The use of a valve stem retainer or a tire manufacturer's stem forming tool are the only acceptable methods of obtaining clearance when necessary.

step1.para: Check the master cylinder reservoir and fill if necessary. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the Master Service Manual for proper brake fluid.
After any brake service, be sure to test brakes prior to returning vehicle to service. A firm pedal should be felt during brake application.

If necessary, bleed brakes. Refer to BLEEDING INSTRUCTIONS
.
